intro: Eschscholzia pseudalcicornis, commonly known as the Sierra foothill poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
